alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 5:24PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW CONTINUES INTO EARLY TONIGHT... Bands of heavy snow continue to impact the Greater Capital Region, Glens Falls Lake George Region, eastern Mohawk Valley Helderbergs, northern and central Taconics, the Berkshires and southern Vermont through 730 pm. Snowfall rates ranging 1 to 2 inches per hour will lead to dangerous travel conditions. Visibilities will lower to a quarter mile or less in the heavy snow. Wind gusts to 25 to 40 mph will cause blowing and drifting snow. Some additional power outages are possible due to the heavy wet snow bringing down tree limbs and power outages. Additional snow amounts of 1 to 4 inches are possible. Avoid all unnecessary travel.
